page.title: 06ECOLOGY 2:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: The fairly dry climate means arable farming is important & with the huge machinery now in use,this has led to loss of hedges,ditches & ponds,but those remaining are often managed with conservation in mind,eg.the A-line hedges on Hedenham Hall Estate.Cereal farming brings with it straw-burning after harvest,but more care recently has led to less damage to wildlife though smoke pollutes the air & charred particles drift into houses. Shooting over the estates & farms has had one valuable effect;it ensures the survival or planting of woods.One is Sexton Wood,90a. of ancient woodland, particularly interesting because it has some of the most northerly Horn- beam in the U.K.;as a Designated SSSI its survival should be secure. Walking & riding are pleasurable with 9 registered footpaths & 6 bridleways.
